Package ohos.agp.components

Class ListContainer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.components.Component
      • ohos.agp.components.ComponentContainer
        • ohos.agp.components.ListContainer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComponentParent, Text.TextObserver

    public class ListContainer
extends ComponentContainer
implements Text.TextObserver
    Provides a list Container that is displayed when scrolling up or down on the screen.

    This class inherits from ComponentContainer. It uses BaseItemProvider to store objects.

    Since:
    3

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static interface  ListContainer.ItemClickedListener
      Listens for click events of ListContainer items.
      static interface  ListContainer.ItemLongClickedListener
      Provides the listener used to listen for and process long-click events of a ListContainer item.
      static interface  ListContainer.ItemSelectedListener
      Listens for selected events of a Component item in the ListContainer object.
      static interface  ListContainer.ItemVisibilityChangedListener
      Provides callbacks to be invoked when a component is added to or removed from the set of visible items.
      static class  ListContainer.ReboundEffectParams
      Represents rebound effect parameters.
      static interface  ListContainer.ScrollListener
      Represents an inner interface used to monitor the end of scrolling of a ListContainer object.

    • Field Detail

      • INVALID_INDEX

        public static final int INVALID_INDEX
        Indicates an invalid index.

        An index is valid only when its index is an integer ranging from 0 to the total number of component items.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ROTATION_SENSITIVITY_DEFAULT

        public static final float ROTATION_SENSITIVITY_DEFAULT
        Indicates the default rotation sensitivity of ListContainer to respond to rotating crown events. You can use Component.setRotationSensitivity(float) to set.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ROTATION_SENSITIVITY_HIGH

        public static final float ROTATION_SENSITIVITY_HIGH
        Indicates the high rotation sensitivity of ListContainer to respond to rotating crown events. You can use Component.setRotationSensitivity(float) to set.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ROTATION_SENSITIVITY_LOW

        public static final float ROTATION_SENSITIVITY_LOW
        Indicates the low rotation sensitivity of ListContainer to respond to rotating crown events. You can use Component.setRotationSensitivity(float) to set.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • onTextUpdated

        public void onTextUpdated​(String text,
                          int start,
                          int before,
                          int count)
        Called back when the text is changed.

        This method is used to process the changed text, for example, to verify the input LOV to get LOVE, for which text is LOVE, start is 3, before is 3, and count is 1.

        Specified by:
        onTextUpdated in interface Text.TextObserver
        Parameters:
        text - Indicates the current text.
        start - Indicates the start position of the text to be added.
        before - Indicates the length of the old text.
        count - Indicates the length of the text to be added.

      • executeItemClick

        public boolean executeItemClick​(Component component,
                                int position,
                                long id)
        Processes a click event of a component item.

        This method is valid only when a click listener is set for the component item.

        Parameters:
        component - Indicates the clicked component item.
        position - Indicates the position of the clicked component item.
        id - Indicates the row ID of the clicked component item.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the click listener is set and the click event is processed; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        4

        Parameters:

      • findComponentById

        public Component findComponentById​(int id)
        Finds the component with the given ID.

        If the ID of the current component itself matches the given ID, the current component is returned. Otherwise, null is returned.

        Overrides:
        findComponentById in class ComponentContainer
        Parameters:
        id - Indicates a unique identifier of a component.
        Returns:
        Returns the component whose ID matches the given ID; returns null if no component is found.

      • addComponent

        public void addComponent​(Component childComponent,
                         int index)
        Adds a component to the specified position.

        If no layout parameters are set for this child component, the default layout parameters of ComponentContainer are used.

        Overrides:
        addComponent in class ComponentContainer
        Parameters:
        childComponent - Indicates the child component to add.
        index - Indicates where to add the child component. The value -1 means to add the component to the end. If a number greater than the value of getChildCount() is provided, a runtime exception is returned.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - Method is not allowed in ListContainer.

      • getComponentAt

        public Component getComponentAt​(int position)
        Obtains the Component from the set of visible items by position. In case of Component is not in the set of visible items null is returned.

        To check if obtained before component is removed from the set of visible items ItemVisibilityChangedListener can be used.

        Overrides:
        getComponentAt in class ComponentContainer
        Parameters:
        position - Indicates the index of child components.
        Returns:
        Returns the Component by position if it is visible, otherwise returns null.
        Since:
        5

      • setReboundEffectParams

        public void setReboundEffectParams​(int overscrollPercent,
                                   float overscrollRate,
                                   int remainVisiblePercent)
        Configure rebound effect parameters.
        Parameters:
        overscrollPercent - Indicates the overscroll percent (default value: 40). If the percent of scrolled content exceeds the value of this parameter, the content scrolling speed is affected by the overscrollRate parameter. Specifically, if the value of overscrollRate is less than 1.0, your finger moves faster than the content.
        overscrollRate - Indicates the overscroll rate (default value: 0.6). This parameter affects the content scrolling speed if the percent of scrolled content exceeds the value of the overscrollPercent parameter. Specifically, the content scrolling speed is equal to the finger scrolling speed multiplied by the value of overscrollRate.
        remainVisiblePercent - Indicates the minimum percent of scrollable content that should remain visible during overscrolling. The default value is 20.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if at least one of the following conditions is true: (1) overscrollPercent is not in range [0, 100] (2) overscrollRate <= 0 (3) remainVisiblePercent is not in range [0, 100]
        Since:
        4

      • setReboundEffectParams

        public void setReboundEffectParams​(ListContainer.ReboundEffectParams reboundEffectParams)
        Sets rebound effect parameters.
        Parameters:
        reboundEffectParams - Indicates a ReboundEffectParams object holding the rebound effect parameters.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if reboundEffectParams is null or contains invalid value.
        Since:
        4
        See Also:
        getReboundEffectParams(), setReboundEffectParams(int, float, int)
